intro: Henriettea goudotiana, commonly known as the Goudot's henriettea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pale green or white, and it is known for its ornamental value in specialized horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
